meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unable to function or operate effectively.
meanings.sent1: The unworkabilities of the old machine were evident as it constantly broke down.
meanings.sent2: The unworkabilities of the plan became apparent when nothing went according to schedule.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the unworkabilities of the broken toy felt like solving a tricky puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The unworkabilities in the system were like tangled wires, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The unworkabilities of the faulty engine were as clear as day, making it impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: Things that are unable to be made to function or operate effectively.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic struggled to repair the unworkabilities in the car's engine.
meanings.sent2: The unworkabilities of the broken clock made it impossible to tell time accurately.
meanings.sent3: The unworkabilities of the malfunctioning robot turned it into a clumsy dancer.
meanings.sent4: The unworkabilities in the faulty design were like roadblocks to progress.
meanings.sent5: The unworkabilities of the tangled wires created a mess that was hard to untangle.
